snippet: Ali Malek Mohammed was convicted of causing the deaths of about 700 people. His fishing boat collided with a Portuguese freighter off Italy....
abstract: Ali Malek Mohammed, Tunisian captain who crashed boat overloaded with migrants into another ship in Mediterranean Sea, killing about 700 people, is sentenced to 18 years in prison for multiple convictions including manslaughter and human trafficking.

byline.original: By GAIA PIANIGIANI and NICK CUMMING-BRUCE
byline.contributor: Gaia Pianigiani reported from Rome, and Nick Cumming-Bruce from Geneva.

lead_paragraph: Ali Malek Mohammed was convicted of causing the deaths of about 700 people. His fishing boat collided with a Portuguese freighter off Italy.

headline.main: Tunisian Captain in Deadly Migrant Shipwreck Jailed for 18 Years
headline.print_headline: Captain of Migrant Ship Jailed for Deadly Wreck

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
